intro: Pisonia donnellsmithii, commonly known as the Hawaiian pisonia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, simple, and ovate leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
